timeline.bodyText:
Not if you want Milliseconds, you can just pass the unit into java.time
TimeUnit.NANOSECONDS.toMillis(VALUE);
timeline.author: prb112

timeline.bodyText: best to use TimeUnit, you get someone else to do these conversions.
timeline.author: prb112

timeline.author: prb112
prb112

timeline.bodyText: If you are splitting resources into separate files, how do you ensure that the same resource or ID is in the same file?
timeline.author: prb112

replies.bodyText:
the tool doesn't really keep all the duplicated resources, it only keep one of them for now.
e.g, in Organization, they are more than 2K lines with the exactly the same contents, the tool will only keep one of them.
replies.author: albertwang-ibm

replies.bodyText:
right - it's not a duplicate resource though... it's a historic resource.
Is the tool removing the historic resource? e.g.
if there are two versions, it'll only insert version 2?
replies.author: prb112

replies.bodyText: In the organization data set, there is no version info in the resource, they are simply duplicated lines of the same contents ... the tool simply keep the first one it runs into and drops all the others.  I thought about making the tool better/smarter to be able to move all duplicated/historic resources into the same file, but because the data set could be huge which could cause huge memory consumption to track which Id is store in which file, so this is why I just made the tool simply for now drop the others resources with the same ids ...
replies.author: albertwang-ibm

replies.bodyText: but It's not bad idea to enhance this tool in the future to make it a real fhir data pre-processing tool, e.g, not only put the resources with the same id into the same file, but also can validate the resource etc ...
replies.author: albertwang-ibm

replies.bodyText:
Is this tool only used in testing?  perhaps move it to src/test/
not the src/main
replies.author: prb112

replies.bodyText: the tool itself is not for any test purpose, I used it mainly as an utility tool to break the huge one piece COS file into multiple to allow them to be able to processed by multiple partitions in parallel ...
replies.author: albertwang-ibm

timeline.bodyText: should still wrap this in a try-catch-close
timeline.author: prb112

replies.bodyText: makes sense even though closing a ByteArrayOutputStream does nothing.
replies.author: albertwang-ibm
